BodyName: Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.7830, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10182, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the twenty year retirement program established for members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed as investigators by district attorneys’ offices”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Retirement program for investigators employed by district attorneys.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Montgomery, S.3265-A, and Assembly Member Robinson, A.6376-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Robert Cradle, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1832, Lot No. 9 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Padavan, S.8288, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to the determination of adjusted base proportions in special assessing units which are cities for the fiscal year 2007”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm

Items.Title: AND SUCH OTHER BUSINESS AS MAY BE NECESSARY

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.7830, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10182, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the twenty year retirement program established for members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed as investigators by district attorneys’ offices”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be P-C Item Approved by Comm approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Retirement program for investigators employed by district attorneys.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.2458-A, and Assembly Member Lavelle, A.4978-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the benefits of the variable supplements fund for housing police and transit police members of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Variable supplements fund for housing police and transit police (S.2458-A, A.4978-A).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.3034-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6233-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to terminal leave”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.5459-B, and Assembly Member Cymbrowitz, A.8375-C, “AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to increasing the earned income tax credit against the personal income tax of a city having a population of one million or more”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Increasing the earned income tax credit against the personal income tax of a city having a pop. of one million or more.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by the Assembly Committee on Rules, A.11989, “AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue the use as parkland of a portion of real property in the borough of Manhattan and to use such property as well as property under the jurisdiction of the city of New York department of transportation for expansion of the West 96th Street Subway Station in exchange for the dedication of certain other lands in the borough of Manhattan for park purposes”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
